meanings.definition: Write (something) in a hurried, careless way.
meanings.sent1: She scrawls her name on the paper quickly.
meanings.sent2: He always scrawls his homework assignments at the last minute.
meanings.sent3: The cat scrawls its paw marks on the wet paint.
meanings.sent4: The wind scrawls patterns in the sand on the beach.
meanings.sent5: The child scrawls with crayons all over the walls.

meanings.definition: A piece of writing or drawing done in a hurried, careless way.
meanings.sent1: The note was just a scrawl on a torn piece of paper.
meanings.sent2: The scrawl on the wall was illegible and messy.
meanings.sent3: The scrawl on the whiteboard made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The scrawl on the sidewalk looked like a secret code.
meanings.sent5: The scrawl on the menu made it hard to read the prices.
